## Description {#details}

This file contains the declarations of the entities induced by Vectorization Plans, e.g.

the instructions the VPlan intends to generate if executed. VPlan models the following entities: VPValue VPUser VPDef | | VPInstruction These are documented in docs/VectorizationPlan.rst.

<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// DESIGN PRINCIPLE: Access to the underlying IR must be strictly limited to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the front-end and back-end of VPlan so that the middle-end is as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// independent as possible of the underlying IR. We grant access to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// underlying IR using friendship. In that way, we should be able to use VPlan</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for multiple underlying IRs (Polly?) by providing a new VPlan front-end,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// back-end and analysis information for the new IR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class augments a recipe with a set of VPValues defined by the recipe.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It allows recipes to define zero, one or multiple VPValues. A VPDef owns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the VPValues it defines and is responsible for deleting its defined values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Single-value VPDefs that also inherit from VPValue must make sure to inherit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from VPDef before VPValue.</span></CodeLine>
